title: 114_s2125
content: The Act titled "Small Business Lending and Economic Inequality Reduction Act of 2015" includes a section on the Community Advantage Program. The Small Business Act is amended to include the Community Advantage Program, which defines covered institutions as development companies, nonprofit intermediaries, and certified community development financial institutions. The Small Business Act is amended to include the Community Advantage Program, which covers development companies, nonprofit intermediaries, and certified community development financial institutions. The program defines terms like Reservist and service-connected. The curr_chunk provides definitions for terms related to the Small Business Act, including "service-connected" and "small business concern in an underserved market" located in specific communities. The curr_chunk outlines eligibility criteria for small businesses to qualify for the Community Advantage Program, including being owned and controlled by veterans or residing in low- or moderate-income communities. The eligibility criteria for small businesses to qualify for the Community Advantage Program include ownership and control by service-disabled veterans, members of the Armed Forces, Reservists, spouses of veterans or Reservists, and surviving spouses of veterans who died on active duty or due to a service-connected disability. The Community Advantage Program guarantees loans for small businesses, with at least 60% going to underserved markets. The maximum loan amount is $350,000, and regulations must be promulgated within a year of enactment. The Administrator must promulgate regulations within a year to carry out a program similar to the Community Advantage Pilot Program. Additionally, a technical amendment is made to the Small Business Act. The Small Business Act is amended to exclude covered institutions from the definition of a business concern. SEC. 3 of the Federal Home Loan Bank Act is amended to include community development financial institutions in the purposes of advances and collateral available.
